  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">32,151</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.5%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>

  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">36,119</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 13.7pt;text-indent:-13.7pt;"><hr size="1" width="25%" noshade color="black" align="left"></div>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .2in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(a)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Includes intercompany
mark-up, priced on an arms-length basis, on products purchased from the company&#146;s
product divisions, which is eliminated in IBM&#146;s consolidated results.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .2in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(b)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Entire amount eliminated for
purposes of IBM&#146;s consolidated results and therefore does not appear on pages&nbsp;4
and 5.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .2in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(c)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">These assets, along with
other financing assets in this table, are leveraged at the value in the table
using Global Financing debt.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .2in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(d)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Global Financing debt is
comprised of intercompany loans and external debt. A portion of Global
Financing debt is in support of the company&#146;s internal business, or related to
intercompany mark-up embedded in the Global Financing assets. See table on page&nbsp;61.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Sources and Uses of Funds</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:13.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The primary use of funds
in Global Financing is to originate client and commercial financing assets.
Client financing assets for end users consist primarily of IBM hardware,
software and services, but also include non-IBM equipment, software and
services to meet IBM clients&#146; total solutions requirements. Client financing
assets are primarily sales-type, direct financing and operating leases for
equipment as well as loans for hardware, software and services with terms generally
from two to seven years. Global Financing&#146;s client loans are primarily for
software and services and are unsecured. These loans are subjected to
additional credit analysis in order to mitigate the associated risk and, when
deemed necessary, covenants are put into agreements to protect against
deterioration during the life of the obligation. Client financing also includes
internal activity as described on page&nbsp;53 of the 2008 IBM Annual Report.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">58</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='58',FILE='C:\JMS\eudelhofen\09-16493-1\task3642809\16493-1-ca.htm',USER='eudelho',CD='Jul 27 14:32 2009' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;"><a href="#TableOfContents" title="Click to go to Table of Contents">Table of Contents</a></font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Management Discussion &#151; (continued)</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:13.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Commercial financing
receivables arise primarily from inventory and accounts receivable financing
for dealers and remarketers of IBM and non-IBM products. Payment terms for
inventory financing and accounts receivable financing generally range from 30
to 90 days.&#160; These short-term receivables
are primarily unsecured and are also subject to additional credit actions in
order to mitigate the associated risk.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:13.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Approximately
98 percent of Global Financing&#146;s external financing assets are in the segment&#146;s
core competency of technology equipment and solutions financing.&#160; At June&nbsp;30, 2009, approximately 59
percent of the external portfolio is with investment grade clients with no
direct exposure to consumers or mortgage lending institutions.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Originations</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The following are total
external and internal financing originations.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" style="border-collapse:collapse;width:100.0%;">

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Total new originations
exceeded cash collections of both client and commercial financing assets in the
second quarter of 2009, which resulted in a net increase in financing assets in
this period. Cash collections of both client and commercial financing assets
exceeded new financing originations in the first six months of 2009, which
resulted in a net decline in financing assets from December&nbsp;31, 2008. The
decrease in originations in both periods in the table above was due to lower
demand for IT equipment associated with the current economic environment.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Cash generated by Global
Financing was primarily deployed to pay the intercompany payables and dividends
to IBM.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Global Financing
Receivables and Allowances</font></p>

presents external financing receivables, excluding residual values, and the
allowance for doubtful accounts.</font></p>

  </td>

  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.26%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="18%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:18.64%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-align:right;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">530</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="3%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:3.08%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.3%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="18%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;border-top:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:18.7%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(87</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="3%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:3.08%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.3%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>

  </td>
  <td width="3%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:3.08%;">

  </td>

  </td>

 <tr height="0">
  <td width="9" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="139" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="23" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="10" style="border:none;"></td>

</table>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .1in;text-indent:-.1in;"><hr size="1" width="25%" noshade color="black" align="left"></div>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .1in;text-indent:-.1in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">* &nbsp;&nbsp;Represents reserved receivables, net of
recoveries, which were disposed of during the period.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .1in;text-indent:-.1in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">** Primarily represents translation adjustments.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">59</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='59',FILE='C:\JMS\eudelhofen\09-16493-1\task3642809\16493-1-ca.htm',USER='eudelho',CD='Jul 27 14:32 2009' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;"><a href="#TableOfContents" title="Click to go to Table of Contents">Table of Contents</a></font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Management Discussion &#151; (continued)</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The percentage of
financing receivables reserved increased from 2.0 percent at December&nbsp;31,
2008 to 2.3 percent at June&nbsp;30, 2009 due to the decline in the gross
financing receivables balance from December&nbsp;31, 2008, and the increase in
the specific allowance for doubtful accounts.&#160;
Specific reserves increased 4.7 percent from $386 million at December&nbsp;31,
2008 to $404 million at June&nbsp;30, 2009.&#160;
Unallocated reserves decreased $16 million from $144&nbsp;million at December&nbsp;31,
2008 to $128&nbsp;million at June&nbsp;30, 2009 due to the decline in gross
financing receivables.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Global Financing&#146;s bad
debt expense was an increase of $83&nbsp;million for the six months ended June&nbsp;30,
2009, compared to an increase of $33&nbsp;million for the six months ended June&nbsp;30,
2008. The increase in bad debt expense was attributed to the growth in specific
reserves.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In the second quarter of
2009, compared to the second quarter of 2008, bad debt expense decreased $26
million.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Residual Value</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Residual value is a risk
unique to the financing business and management of this risk is dependent upon
the ability to accurately project future equipment values at lease
inception.&#160; Global Financing has insight
into product plans and cycles for the IBM products under lease. &#160;Based upon this product information, Global
Financing continually monitors projections of future equipment values and
compares them with the residual values reflected in the portfolio.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Global Financing optimizes the recovery of residual
values by selling assets sourced from end of lease, leasing used equipment to
new clients, or extending lease arrangements with current clients.&#160; Sales of equipment, which are primarily
sourced from equipment returned at the end of a lease, represented 44.4 percent
and 40.7 percent of Global Financing&#146;s revenue in the second quarter and first
six months, respectively, of 2009 and 41.7 percent and 36.9 percent in the
second quarter and first six months, respectively, of 2008.&#160; The increase in the second quarter and the
first six months of 2009 was driven primarily by the decrease in financing
revenue.&#160; The gross margins on these
sales were 53.7 percent and 50.1 percent in the second quarter of 2009 and
2008, respectively.&#160; The gross margins
were 52.0 percent and 47.8 percent for the first six months of 2009 and 2008,
respectively.&#160; The increase in both
periods is driven primarily by higher margin internal sales.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The following table
presents the recorded amount of unguaranteed residual value for sales-type and
direct financing leases and operating leases at December&nbsp;31, 2008 and June&nbsp;30,
2009. In addition, the table presents the residual value as a percentage of the
related original amount financed and a run out of when the unguaranteed
residual value assigned to equipment on leases at June&nbsp;30, 2009 is
expected to be returned to the company. In addition to the unguaranteed
residual value below, on a limited basis, Global Financing will obtain
guarantees of the future value of the equipment to be returned at end of lease.
These third-party guarantees are included in minimum lease payments as provided
for by accounting standards in the determination of lease classifications for
the covered equipment and provide protection against risk of loss arising from
declines in equipment values for these assets.&#160;
The residual value guarantee increases the minimum lease payments that
are utilized in determining the classification of a lease as a sales-type lease
or operating lease. The aggregate asset values associated with the guarantees
were $160&nbsp;million and $280&nbsp;million for the financing transactions
originated during the quarters ended June&nbsp;30, 2009 and June&nbsp;30, 2008,
respectively, and $266&nbsp;million and $478&nbsp;million for the six months
ended June&nbsp;30, 2009 and June&nbsp;30, 2008, respectively. The associated
aggregate guaranteed future values at the scheduled end of lease were
$10&nbsp;million and $18&nbsp;million for the financing transactions originated
during the quarters ended June&nbsp;30, 2009 and June&nbsp;30, 2008,
respectively, and $16&nbsp;million and $30 million for the financing
transactions originated during the six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2009 and June&nbsp;30,
2008, respectively. The cost of guarantees was $1.3&nbsp;million for the
quarter ended June&nbsp;30, 2009 and $2.3&nbsp;million for the quarter ended June&nbsp;30,
2008, and $2.1&nbsp;million and $4&nbsp;million for each of the six months
ended June&nbsp;30, 2009 and June&nbsp;30, 2008, respectively.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">60</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Debt</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  <td width="3%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:3.52%;">

  <td width="57%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:57.76%;">

  <td width="3%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:3.52%;">

  <td width="3%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:3.52%;">

  <td width="57%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:57.76%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Debt-to-equity
  ratio</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="3%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:3.52%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  <td width="16%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:16.9%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">6.9</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="3%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:3.52%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">X</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:16.9%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">7.0</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.4%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">X</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
company</font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;"> funds Global
Financing through borrowings using a debt-to-equity ratio target of
approximately 7 to 1. The debt used to fund Global Financing assets is composed
of intercompany loans and external debt. The terms of the intercompany loans
are set by the company to substantially match the term and currency underlying
the financing receivable and are based on arm&#146;s-length pricing. Both assets and
debt are presented in the Global Financing balance sheet on page&nbsp;58.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Global Financing
business provides funding predominantly for the company&#146;s external clients but
also provides intercompany financing for the company. As previously stated, the
company measures&#160; Global Financing as if
it were a standalone entity and accordingly, interest expense relating to debt
supporting Global Financing&#146;s external client and internal business is included
in the &#147;Global Financing Results of Operations&#148; on page&nbsp;57 and in Segment
Information on pages&nbsp;70 and 71.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In the company&#146;s
Consolidated Statement of Earnings on page&nbsp;3, however, the external
debt-related interest expense supporting Global Financing&#146;s internal financing
to the company is reclassified from Cost of Financing to Interest Expense.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The following table provides additional information on total company debt.
In this table, intercompany activity is comprised of internal loans and leases
at arm&#146;s length pricing in support of Global Services&#146; long-term contracts and
other internal activity. The company believes these assets should be
appropriately leveraged in line with the overall Global Financing business
model.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" style="border-collapse:collapse;width:100.0%;">

  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-weight:bold;">(Dollars in millions)</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.5%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

  2009</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.5%;">

  <td width="41%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:41.0%;">

  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.5%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="12%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:12.0%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>

  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.3%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="10%" valign="bottom" style="border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:10.7%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">33,926</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr height="0">
  <td width="307" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="19" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="10" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="80" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="19" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="10" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="80" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="19" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="10" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="80" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="19" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="10" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="80" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="7" style="border:none;"></td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Liquidity and Capital
Resources</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Global Financing is a
segment of the company and as such, is supported by the company&#146;s overall
liquidity position and access to capital markets. Cash generated by Global
Financing was primarily deployed to pay intercompany payables and dividends to
the company in order to maintain an appropriate debt-to-equity ratio.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">61</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>

  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="12%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:12.0%;">

  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">%</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="1" width="25%" noshade color="black" align="left"></div>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">*</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Calculated based
upon an estimated tax rate principally based on Global Financing&#146;s geographic
mix of earnings as IBM&#146;s provision for income taxes is determined on a
consolidated basis.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">**</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Average of the
ending equity for Global Financing for the last 2 quarters and 3 quarters, for
the three months ended June&nbsp;30, and for the six months ended June&nbsp;30,
respectively.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Looking Forward</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:13.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Global Financing&#146;s
financial position provides flexibility and funding capacity which enables the
company to be well positioned in the current environment. Global Financing&#146;s
assets and new financing volumes are primarily IBM products and services
financed to the company&#146;s clients and business partners, and substantially all
financing assets are IT related assets which provide a stable base of business
for future growth.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:13.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The company&#146;s System z
and high-end converged System p servers announced in 2008 continue to be a
significant financing opportunity. Global Financing&#146;s offerings are competitive
and available to clients as a result of the company&#146;s borrowing cost and access
to the capital markets. Overall, Global Financing&#146;s originations will be
dependent upon the demand for IT products and services as well as client
participation rates.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:13.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">IBM continues to access
both the short-term commercial paper market and the medium and long-term debt
markets.&#160; A protracted period where IBM
could not access the capital markets would likely lead to a slowdown in originations.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:13.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Interest rates and the
overall economy (including currency fluctuations) will have an effect on both
revenue and gross profit. The company&#146;s interest rate risk management policy,
however, combined with the Global Financing pricing strategy should mitigate
gross margin erosion due to changes in interest rates.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:13.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The economy could impact
the credit quality of the Global Financing receivables portfolio and therefore
the level of provision for bad debts. Global Financing will continue to apply
rigorous credit policies in both the origination of new business and the
evaluation of the existing portfolio.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As discussed on page&nbsp;60,
Global Financing has historically been able to manage residual value risk both
through insight into the company&#146;s product cycles, as well as through its remarketing
business.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Global Financing has policies in place to manage each
of the key risks involved in financing. These policies, combined with product
and client knowledge, should allow for the prudent management of the business
going forward, even during periods of uncertainty with respect to the economy.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">62</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Forward Looking and Cautionary Statements</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Except for the historical information and discussions
contained herein, statements contained in this release may constitute
forward-looking statements within the meaning of the Private Securities
Litigation Reform Act of 1995.&nbsp; These statements involve a number of
risks, uncertainties and other factors that could cause actual results to
differ materially, including the following: a downturn in the economic
environment and corporate IT spending budgets; the company&#146;s failure to meet
growth and productivity objectives; a failure of the company&#146;s innovation
initiatives; risks from investing in growth opportunities; failure of the
company&#146;s intellectual property portfolio to prevent competitive offerings and
the failure of the company to obtain necessary licenses; breaches of data
protection; fluctuations in revenues and purchases; impact of local legal,
economic, political and health conditions; adverse effects from environmental
matters, tax matters and the company&#146;s pension plans; ineffective internal
controls; the company&#146;s use of accounting estimates; competitive conditions;
the company&#146;s ability to attract and retain key personnel and its reliance on
critical skills; impact of relationships with critical suppliers; currency
fluctuations and customer financing risks; impact of changes in market
liquidity conditions and customer credit risk on receivables; reliance on third
party distribution channels; the company&#146;s ability to successfully manage
acquisitions and alliances; risk factors related to IBM securities; and other
risks, uncertainties and factors discussed in the company&#146;s Form&nbsp;10-Q, Form&nbsp;10-K
and in the company&#146;s other filings with the U.S. Securities and Exchange
Commission (SEC) or in materials incorporated therein by reference.&nbsp; The
company assumes no obligation to update or revise any forward-looking
statements.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Item</font></b><b><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;"> 4.
Controls and Procedures</font></b><a name="Item4_ControlsAndProcedures_025721"></a></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
company&#146;s management evaluated, with the participation of the Chief Executive
Officer and Chief Financial Officer, the effectiveness of the company&#146;s
disclosure controls and procedures as of the end of the period covered by this
report. Based on that evaluation, the Chief Executive Officer and Chief
Financial Officer have concluded that the company&#146;s disclosure controls and
procedures were effective as of the end of the period covered by this report.
There has been no change in the company&#146;s internal control over financial
reporting that occurred during the quarter covered by this report that has
materially affected, or is reasonably likely to materially affect, the company&#146;s
internal control over financial reporting.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Part&nbsp;</font></b><b><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">II</font></b><b><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;"> &#151; Other Information</font></b><a name="PartiiOtherInformation_025723"></a></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Item 1.&#160; Legal
Proceedings</font></b><a name="Item1_LegalProceedings_025724"></a></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Refer
to Note 14, &#147;Contingencies,&#148; on pages&nbsp;24 to 26 of this Form&nbsp;10-Q.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.5in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Item
2.&#160; Unregistered Sales of Equity
Securities and Use of Proceeds and Issuer Repurchases of Equity Securities</font></b><a name="Item2_UnregisteredSalesOfEquitySe_025725"></a></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
following table provides information relating to the company&#146;s repurchase of
common stock for the second quarter of 2009.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  </td>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="1" width="25%" noshade color="black" align="left"></div>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .2in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">*</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On February&nbsp;26, 2008, the Board of
Directors authorized $15.0 billion in funds for use in the company&#146;s common
stock repurchase program; the company stated that it would repurchase shares on
the open market or in private transactions depending on market conditions, and
that it expects to use cash from operations for the repurchases. On April&nbsp;28,
2009, the Board of Directors authorized an additional $3.0 billion in funds for
use in such programs. The common stock repurchase program does not have an
expiration date. This table does not include shares tendered to satisfy the
exercise price in connection with cashless exercises of employee stock options
or shares tendered to satisfy tax withholding obligations in connection with
employee equity awards.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">63</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;"><a href="#TableOfContents" title="Click to go to Table of Contents">Table of
Contents</a></font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Item 4. Submission of Matters to a Vote of Security
Holders</font></b><a name="Item4_SubmissionOfMattersToAVoteO_024801"></a></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">International
Business Machines Corporation held its Annual Meeting of Stockholders on April&nbsp;28,
2009. For more information on the following proposals, see the company&#146;s proxy
statement dated March&nbsp;9, 2009, the relevant portions of which are
incorporated herein by reference.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-34.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(1)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The stockholders elected
each of the twelve nominees to the Board of Directors for a one-year term by a
majority of the votes cast:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<div align="center">

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="59%" style="border-collapse:collapse;width:59.98%;">
 <tr>
  <td width="33%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:33.34%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-weight:bold;">DIRECTOR</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="3%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:3.74%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="17%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:17.98%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-weight:bold;">FOR</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="3%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:3.74%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="17%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:17.98%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-weight:bold;">AGAINST</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="3%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:3.74%;">

Pension Income:</font></p>

  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="91%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:91.96%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="5%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:5.92%;">

  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.14%;">

  </td>
  <td width="91%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:91.96%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Certification
  by CEO pursuant to 18 U.S.C. Section&nbsp;1350, as adopted pursuant to
  Section&nbsp;906 of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002.</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>

  <td width="5%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:5.92%;">

  data files pursuant to Rule&nbsp;405 of Regulation S-T: (i)&nbsp;the
  Consolidated Statement of Earnings for the three and six month periods ended June&nbsp;30,

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">SIGNATURE</font></b><a name="Signature_024826"></a></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Pursuant
to the requirements of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, the registrant has
duly caused this report to be signed on its behalf by the undersigned thereunto
duly authorized.</font></p>
